content.summary: This Construction Contract Agreement between Skyline Development Corporation (Owner) and BuildRight Construction, LLC (Contractor) governs the construction of a mixed-use commercial building in Chicago, Illinois. The contract sum is $28.5 million with specified alternates and unit prices. The Contractor is responsible for all labor, materials, permits, and compliance with plans, specifications, and applicable laws, including LEED Gold certification requirements. The contract sets strict timelines for commencement, substantial completion (540 days), and final completion (60 days after substantial completion). Payments are made monthly based on progress with retainage withheld and released upon completion milestones. The agreement includes provisions for insurance, bonds, changes in work, correction of defective work, termination rights for both parties, dispute resolution via mediation or Illinois courts, and special conditions addressing urban site challenges. The governing law is Illinois. Risks include potential delays, payment withholding, compliance failures, and termination. Critical clauses emphasize time performance, payment terms, termination rights, change management, and bonding requirements.

analysis.content:
CONSTRUCTION CONTRACT AGREEMENT

THIS CONSTRUCTION CONTRACT AGREEMENT (the "Agreement") is made and entered into on this 15th day of April, 2025 ("Effective Date")

BETWEEN:

SKYLINE DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION, a corporation organized and existing under the laws of the State of Delaware, with its principal office located at 1234 Corporate Drive, Suite 500, Wilmington, DE 19801 (hereinafter referred to as the "Owner")

AND:

BUILDRIGHT CONSTRUCTION, LLC, a limited liability company organized and existing under the laws of the State of New York, with its principal office located at 567 Builder's Way, New York, NY 10001 (hereinafter referred to as the "Contractor")

RECITALS:

WHEREAS, the Owner is the fee simple owner of certain real property located at 789 Development Avenue, Chicago, IL 60601, as more particularly described in Exhibit A attached hereto (the "Project Site"); and

WHEREAS, the Owner desires to construct a mixed-use commercial building on the Project Site (the "Project"); and

WHEREAS, the Contractor is in the business of providing construction services and has the necessary expertise, licenses, and resources to construct the Project; and

WHEREAS, the Owner desires to engage the Contractor to construct the Project according to the plans and specifications prepared by Architectural Innovations, Inc., dated March 1, 2025 (the "Plans and Specifications"); and

WHEREAS, the Contractor desires to provide such construction services to the Owner under the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements herein contained, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties agree as follows:

ARTICLE 1 - SCOPE OF WORK

1.1 The Contractor shall furnish all labor, materials, equipment, tools, supervision, and other items necessary to construct the Project in accordance with the Plans and Specifications and the terms of this Agreement.

1.2 The scope of work includes, but is not limited to, the following: a) Site preparation and excavation b) Foundation work c) Structural framing d) Exterior walls and roofing e) Mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems f) Interior finishes g) Landscaping and hardscaping h) All other work shown on or reasonably inferable from the Plans and Specifications

1.3 The Contractor shall obtain all necessary permits and approvals required for the construction of the Project, the cost of which shall be included in the Contract Sum.

ARTICLE 2 - CONTRACT DOCUMENTS

2.1 The Contract Documents consist of: a) This Construction Contract Agreement b) The Plans and Specifications c) The Construction Schedule (Exhibit B) d) The Schedule of Values (Exhibit C) e) The General Conditions (Exhibit D) f) The Special Conditions (Exhibit E) g) Change Orders and Construction Change Directives issued after execution of this Agreement

2.2 In the event of any inconsistency, conflict, or ambiguity among the Contract Documents, the documents shall govern in the order in which they are listed in Section 2.1.

ARTICLE 3 - TIME OF PERFORMANCE

3.1 The Contractor shall commence the Work within fourteen (14) days after receiving a written notice to proceed from the Owner.

3.2 The Contractor shall achieve Substantial Completion of the entire Work not later than five hundred forty (540) calendar days from the date of commencement, subject to adjustments as provided in the Contract Documents.

3.3 "Substantial Completion" means the stage in the progress of the Work when the Work or designated portion thereof is sufficiently complete in accordance with the Contract Documents so that the Owner can occupy or utilize the Work for its intended use, with only minor items remaining to be completed or corrected.

3.4 The Contractor shall achieve Final Completion of the Work not later than sixty (60) calendar days after the date of Substantial Completion. "Final Completion" means the stage when the Work has been completed in accordance with the Contract Documents and the Owner has received all documents and items necessary for closeout of the Project.

3.5 Time is of the essence with respect to all dates and time periods set forth in the Contract Documents.

ARTICLE 4 - CONTRACT SUM

4.1 The Owner shall pay the Contractor the sum of Twenty-Eight Million Five Hundred Thousand Dollars ($28,500,000.00) (the "Contract Sum") for the Contractor's performance of this Agreement, subject to additions and deductions as provided in the Contract Documents.

4.2 The Contract Sum is based on the following alternates, which are described in the Contract Documents and are hereby accepted by the Owner: a) Alternate No. 1: Upgraded lobby finishes - $350,000.00 b) Alternate No. 2: Green roof system - $750,000.00 c) Alternate No. 3: Enhanced security system - $425,000.00

4.3 Unit prices, if any, are as follows: a) Excavation of unsuitable soil and replacement with compacted fill: $65.00 per cubic yard b) Additional concrete footings: $550.00 per cubic yard c) Additional structural steel: $4,200.00 per ton

ARTICLE 5 - PAYMENT

5.1 Based upon Applications for Payment submitted by the Contractor, the Owner shall make progress payments on account of the Contract Sum to the Contractor as provided in the Contract Documents.

5.2 The period covered by each Application for Payment shall be one calendar month ending on the last day of the month.

5.3 The Owner shall make payment to the Contractor within thirty (30) days after the Owner's receipt of the Application for Payment.

5.4 Each Application for Payment shall be based upon the Schedule of Values submitted by the Contractor and approved by the Owner. The Schedule of Values shall allocate the entire Contract Sum among the various portions of the Work.

5.5 Each Application for Payment shall show the percentage of completion of each portion of the Work as of the end of the period covered by the Application for Payment.

5.6 Subject to other provisions of the Contract Documents, the amount of each progress payment shall be computed as follows: a) Take that portion of the Contract Sum properly allocable to completed Work as determined by multiplying the percentage completion of each portion of the Work by the share of the Contract Sum allocated to that portion of the Work in the Schedule of Values. b) Add that portion of the Contract Sum properly allocable to materials and equipment delivered and suitably stored at the site for subsequent incorporation in the completed construction (or, if approved in advance by the Owner, suitably stored off the site at a location agreed upon in writing). c) Subtract the aggregate of previous payments made by the Owner. d) Subtract amounts, if any, for which the Architect has withheld or nullified a Certificate for Payment as provided in the General Conditions. e) Subtract retainage of five percent (5%) from the above amount.

5.7 Retainage shall be released as follows: a) Upon Substantial Completion of the entire Work, the Owner shall release fifty percent (50%) of the accumulated retainage. b) The remaining retainage shall be paid with the final payment upon Final Completion of the Work.

5.8 Final payment shall be made by the Owner to the Contractor when: a) The Contractor has fully performed the Work in accordance with the Contract Documents, except for the Contractor's responsibility to correct defective work as provided in the General Conditions and to satisfy other requirements, if any, which necessarily survive final payment. b) The Contractor has submitted a final Application for Payment. c) The Contractor has provided all closeout documents required by the Contract Documents.

ARTICLE 6 - CONTRACTOR'S REPRESENTATIONS

6.1 The Contractor makes the following representations: a) The Contractor has examined and carefully studied the Contract Documents and the other related data identified in the Contract Documents. b) The Contractor has visited the Project Site and become familiar with and is satisfied as to the general, local, and site conditions that may affect cost, progress, and performance of the Work. c) The Contractor is familiar with and is satisfied as to all federal, state, and local laws and regulations that may affect cost, progress, and performance of the Work. d) The Contractor has carefully studied all reports of explorations and tests of subsurface conditions at or contiguous to the site and all drawings of physical conditions in or relating to existing surface or subsurface structures at or contiguous to the site which have been provided by the Owner. e) The Contractor has obtained and carefully studied (or assumes responsibility for having done so) all additional or supplementary examinations, investigations, explorations, tests, studies, and data concerning conditions (surface, subsurface, and underground facilities) at or contiguous to the site which may affect cost, progress, or performance of the Work or which relate to any aspect of the means, methods, techniques, sequences, and procedures of construction to be employed by the Contractor, including applying the specific means, methods, techniques, sequences, and procedures of construction expressly required by the Contract Documents to be employed by the Contractor, and safety precautions and programs incident thereto. f) The Contractor does not consider that any further examinations, investigations, explorations, tests, studies, or data are necessary for the performance of the Work at the Contract Sum, within the Contract Time, and in accordance with the other terms and conditions of the Contract Documents. g) The Contractor is aware of the general nature of work to be performed by the Owner and others at the Project Site that relates to the Work as indicated in the Contract Documents. h) The Contractor has correlated the information known to the Contractor, information and observations obtained from visits to the Project Site, reports and drawings identified in the Contract Documents, and all additional examinations, investigations, explorations, tests, studies, and data with the Contract Documents. i) The Contractor has given the Owner written notice of all conflicts, errors, ambiguities, or discrepancies that the Contractor has discovered in the Contract Documents, and the written resolution thereof by the Owner is acceptable to the Contractor. j) The Contract Documents are generally sufficient to indicate and convey understanding of all terms and conditions for performance and furnishing of the Work.

ARTICLE 7 - INSURANCE AND BONDS

7.1 The Contractor shall purchase and maintain insurance as set forth in the General Conditions and elsewhere in the Contract Documents.

7.2 The Contractor shall provide performance and payment bonds, each in an amount equal to the Contract Sum as security for the faithful performance and payment of all of the Contractor's obligations under the Contract Documents.

7.3 The performance and payment bonds shall be issued by a solvent surety company authorized to do business in the State of Illinois and shall be delivered to the Owner prior to commencement of the Work.

ARTICLE 8 - CHANGES IN THE WORK

8.1 Changes in the Work may be accomplished after execution of this Agreement, and without invalidating the Agreement, by Change Order, Construction Change Directive, or order for a minor change in the Work, subject to the limitations stated in the Contract Documents.

8.2 A Change Order shall be based upon agreement among the Owner, Contractor, and Architect; a Construction Change Directive requires agreement by the Owner and Architect and may or may not be agreed to by the Contractor; an order for a minor change in the Work may be issued by the Architect alone.

8.3 Changes in the Work shall be performed under applicable provisions of the Contract Documents, and the Contractor shall proceed promptly, unless otherwise provided in the Change Order, Construction Change Directive, or order for a minor change in the Work.

ARTICLE 9 - CORRECTION OF WORK

9.1 The Contractor shall promptly correct Work rejected by the Architect or failing to conform to the requirements of the Contract Documents, whether discovered before or after Substantial Completion and whether or not fabricated, installed, or completed. Costs of correcting such rejected Work, including additional testing and inspections and compensation for the Architect's services and expenses made necessary thereby, shall be at the Contractor's expense.

9.2 In addition to the Contractor's obligations under Article 3, if, within one year after the date of Substantial Completion of the Work or designated portion thereof or after the date for commencement of warranties established under the Contract Documents, or by terms of an applicable special warranty required by the Contract Documents, any of the Work is found to be not in accordance with the requirements of the Contract Documents, the Contractor shall correct it promptly after receipt of written notice from the Owner to do so unless the Owner has previously given the Contractor a written acceptance of such condition.

ARTICLE 10 - TERMINATION OR SUSPENSION

10.1 The Owner may terminate the Contract if the Contractor: a) Persistently or repeatedly refuses or fails to supply enough properly skilled workers or proper materials; b) Fails to make payment to Subcontractors for materials or labor in accordance with the respective agreements between the Contractor and the Subcontractors; c) Persistently disregards laws, ordinances, or rules, regulations, or orders of a public authority having jurisdiction; or d) Otherwise is guilty of substantial breach of a provision of the Contract Documents.

10.2 When any of the above reasons exists, the Owner may, without prejudice to any other rights or remedies of the Owner, terminate the Contract and take possession of the site and of all materials, equipment, tools, and construction equipment and machinery thereon owned by the Contractor and may finish the Work by whatever reasonable method the Owner may deem expedient.

10.3 The Contractor may terminate the Contract if: a) The Work is stopped for a period of 60 consecutive days through no act or fault of the Contractor or a Subcontractor or their agents or employees or any other persons performing portions of the Work under contract with the Contractor because the Owner has persistently failed to fulfill the Owner's obligations under the Contract Documents with respect to matters important to the progress of the Work; b) The Owner fails to pay the Contractor amounts due within 60 days after such amounts are certified by the Architect; or c) The Owner otherwise materially breaches the Contract.

10.4 The Owner may, without cause, order the Contractor in writing to suspend, delay, or interrupt the Work in whole or in part for such period of time as the Owner may determine.

ARTICLE 11 - DISPUTE RESOLUTION

11.1 Claims, disputes, or other matters in question between the parties arising out of or relating to this Agreement or breach thereof shall be subject to and decided by mediation if the parties mutually agree, or in a court of competent jurisdiction within the State of Illinois.

11.2 The parties shall share the mediator's fee and any filing fees equally. The mediation shall be held in Chicago, Illinois, unless another location is mutually agreed upon.

11.3 Agreements reached in mediation shall be enforceable as settlement agreements in any court having jurisdiction thereof.

ARTICLE 12 - MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS

12.1 This Agreement shall be governed by the law of the State of Illinois.

12.2 The Owner and Contractor respectively bind themselves, their partners, successors, assigns, and legal representatives to the other party hereto and to partners, successors, assigns, and legal representatives of such other party in respect to covenants, agreements, and obligations contained in the Contract Documents.

12.3 Neither party to the Contract shall assign the Contract as a whole without written consent of the other. If either party attempts to make such an assignment without such consent, that party shall nevertheless remain legally responsible for all obligations under the Contract.

12.4 Nothing contained in this Agreement shall create a contractual relationship with or a cause of action in favor of a third party against either the Owner or Contractor.

12.5 No waiver of any provision of this Agreement shall be effective unless made in writing and signed by the waiving party. The failure of any party to require the performance of any term or obligation of this Agreement, or the waiver by any party of any breach of this Agreement, shall not prevent any subsequent enforcement of such term or obligation or be deemed a waiver of any subsequent breach.

12.6 If any provision of this Agreement is held invalid or unenforceable, the remainder of this Agreement shall nevertheless remain in full force and effect. If any provision is held invalid or unenforceable with respect to particular circumstances, it shall nevertheless remain in full force and effect in all other circumstances.

12.7 All notices required to be given under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be sent by certified mail, return receipt requested, or by a recognized overnight courier service with delivery confirmation, to the addresses set forth in the preamble of this Agreement or to such other address as either party may designate in writing.

ARTICLE 13 - SPECIAL CONDITIONS

13.1 The Project is located in a highly congested urban area, and the Contractor shall take all necessary precautions to minimize disruption to neighboring properties and businesses. The Contractor shall comply with all city noise ordinances and shall restrict noisy operations to the hours of 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., Monday through Friday, unless otherwise authorized by the Owner.

13.2 The Contractor shall implement and maintain a site-specific safety plan that addresses the unique challenges of this urban construction project, including but not limited to pedestrian protection, traffic management, and crane operations.

13.3 The Contractor shall implement a waste management plan that maximizes recycling and minimizes landfill disposal, with a goal of diverting at least 75% of construction waste from landfills.

13.4 The Project is designed to achieve LEED Gold certification, and the Contractor shall comply with all LEED-related requirements specified in the Contract Documents.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have executed this Agreement as of the date first written above.

OWNER: SKYLINE DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION

By: ______________________________ Patricia J. Reynolds, President

Date: ____________________________

CONTRACTOR: BUILDRIGHT CONSTRUCTION, LLC

By: ______________________________ Michael T. Hernandez, Managing Member

Date: ____________________________

EXHIBIT A - LEGAL DESCRIPTION OF PROJECT SITE

[Legal description of property to be inserted]

EXHIBIT B - CONSTRUCTION SCHEDULE

[Construction schedule to be attached]

EXHIBIT C - SCHEDULE OF VALUES

[Schedule of values to be attached]

EXHIBIT D - GENERAL CONDITIONS

[General conditions to be attached]

EXHIBIT E - SPECIAL CONDITIONS

[Special conditions to be attached]
analysis.summary: This Construction Contract Agreement between Skyline Development Corporation (Owner) and BuildRight Construction, LLC (Contractor) governs the construction of a mixed-use commercial building in Chicago, Illinois. The contract sum is $28.5 million with specified alternates and unit prices. The Contractor is responsible for all labor, materials, permits, and compliance with plans, specifications, and applicable laws, including LEED Gold certification requirements. The contract sets strict timelines for commencement, substantial completion (540 days), and final completion (60 days after substantial completion). Payments are made monthly based on progress with retainage withheld and released upon completion milestones. The agreement includes provisions for insurance, bonds, changes in work, correction of defective work, termination rights for both parties, dispute resolution via mediation or Illinois courts, and special conditions addressing urban site challenges. The governing law is Illinois. Risks include potential delays, payment withholding, compliance failures, and termination. Critical clauses emphasize time performance, payment terms, termination rights, change management, and bonding requirements.

structuredData.title: Construction Contract Agreement

financialTerms.paymentSchedule: Progress payments monthly based on Applications for Payment, payable within 30 days after receipt; retainage of 5% withheld and partially released at Substantial Completion and Final Completion
financialTerms.penalties: Not explicitly stated; time is of the essence; Owner may withhold payments if Architect nullifies Certificate for Payment

keyObligations: Contractor to furnish all labor, materials, equipment, tools, supervision, and other items necessary to construct the Project per Plans and Specifications
Contractor to obtain all necessary permits and approvals at own cost
Contractor to commence work within 14 days after written notice to proceed
Contractor to achieve Substantial Completion within 540 calendar days from commencement
Contractor to achieve Final Completion within 60 calendar days after Substantial Completion
Contractor to maintain insurance and provide performance and payment bonds equal to Contract Sum
Contractor to correct defective or nonconforming work promptly, including within one year after Substantial Completion
Contractor to comply with city noise ordinances and restrict noisy operations to 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. weekdays
Contractor to implement site-specific safety and waste management plans
Contractor to comply with LEED Gold certification requirements
terminationConditions: Owner may terminate if Contractor persistently fails to supply skilled workers or proper materials
Owner may terminate if Contractor fails to pay Subcontractors
Owner may terminate if Contractor disregards laws or is guilty of substantial breach
Contractor may terminate if Work is stopped for 60 consecutive days due to Owner's failure to fulfill obligations
Contractor may terminate if Owner fails to pay certified amounts within 60 days
Owner may terminate for cause without prejudice to other remedies
Owner may suspend, delay, or interrupt work without cause by written order

financialRisks.description: Potential delays causing increased costs and penalties due to time being of the essence
Owner withholding payments if work is not approved or progress is insufficient

legalRisks.description: Disputes arising from contract interpretation or breach requiring mediation or litigation
Non-compliance with permits, laws, and regulations leading to penalties or work stoppage

performanceRisks.description: Failure to achieve Substantial or Final Completion on time
Defective or nonconforming work requiring correction at Contractor's expense
Challenges related to urban site conditions affecting safety and operations

terminationRisks.description: Contract termination by Owner for Contractor's breaches or failures
Contractor termination for Owner's failure to pay or fulfill obligations

complianceRisks.description: Failure to comply with LEED Gold certification requirements
Non-compliance with city noise ordinances and safety regulations

criticalClauses.concern: Time is of the essence with strict deadlines for Substantial and Final Completion which may expose parties to penalties or disputes if delays occur
criticalClauses.recommendation: Implement rigorous project management and contingency planning to mitigate delay risks

criticalClauses.concern: Retainage of 5% withheld and partial release only upon Substantial Completion may impact Contractor cash flow
criticalClauses.recommendation: Contractor should ensure sufficient working capital and monitor payment applications closely

criticalClauses.concern: Owner has broad rights to terminate for cause and suspend work without cause, which may disrupt Contractor operations
criticalClauses.recommendation: Maintain clear documentation of performance and communications to defend against wrongful termination or suspension

criticalClauses.concern: Changes may be directed by Owner or Architect, potentially impacting schedule and costs
criticalClauses.recommendation: Establish clear procedures and timely approvals for change orders to manage scope and budget

criticalClauses.concern: Requirement for performance and payment bonds equal to Contract Sum may be financially burdensome
criticalClauses.recommendation: Contractor should secure bonds early and verify coverage to avoid delays
